hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Regime Transition: Neutral to Bull Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) with 20-day realized volatility (RV20) compressing below 40% while 1-month implied volatility (IV30) remains above 55%, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound on >1.5x average volume will lead to a sustained volatility expansion where RV20 increases by >15 percentage points within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Current neutral regime with high IV30 suggests options markets pricing in future volatility. Compression in realized volatility creates pent-up energy. Breakout with volume confirms regime transition. JPMorgan's $170K BTC thesis creates asymmetric upside volatility expectations.
entry_conditions: BTC RV20 < 40% AND BTC IV30 > 55% (volatility risk premium > 15%)
BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound (2 std)

exit_conditions.take_profit: RV20 increases by 15 percentage points from entry level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price closes below 20-day moving average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain and RV20 remains compressed or declines further despite breakout signal.
